bugs.title: Lightning not working in SeaMonkey 2.49.5 due to --disable-calendar

bugzilla.short_desc: Lightning not working in SeaMonkey 2.49.5 due to --disable-calendar

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
The Lightning and Lightbird add-on does not work with seamonkey-2.49.5-1 because SeaMonkey was configured with --disable-calendar. Instead it must be configured with --enable-calendar. See: https://groups.google.com/d/msg/mozilla.support.seamonkey/DWj2unF91to/HGyqasDkAgAJ


Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
seamonkey-2.49.5-1.fc30.x86_64

How reproducible:
Always.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install seamonkey-2.49.5-1.fc30.x86_64
2. Install Lightning or Lightbird add-on
3. Open the Lightnin or Lightbird calendar

Actual results:
Blank window with Lightning, error message with Lightbird.

Expected results:
Calendar shows and is usable.

Additional info:
See also https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-7f7489dc8c

Please test new build:
https://kojipkgs.fedoraproject.org//packages/seamonkey/2.49.5/2.fc30/x86_64/seamonkey-2.49.5-2.fc30.x86_64.rpm
It does not provide its own bundled lightning, but all the needed things should be compiled in. If it does not work, try to play with emptying profiles etc...
works for me
FEDORA-2019-92bd15f74a has been submitted as an update to Fedora 31. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-92bd15f74a
FEDORA-2019-ea200bba7e has been submitted as an update to Fedora 30. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-ea200bba7e
FEDORA-2019-763a99010a has been submitted as an update to Fedora 29. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-763a99010a

seamonkey-2.49.5-2.fc31 has been pushed to the Fedora 31 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for
instructions on how to install test updates.
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-92bd15f74a

Lightning works now, but with Lightbird I still get:

XML Parsing Error: undefined entity
Location: chrome://lightbird/content/sunbird/calendar.xul
Line Number 53, Column 1:

<window id="calendar-window"
^

seamonkey-2.49.5-2.fc30 has been pushed to the Fedora 30 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for
instructions on how to install test updates.
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-ea200bba7e

See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for
instructions on how to install test updates.
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-763a99010a

People report that lightbird works with updated seamonkey-2.49.5-2, see
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-7f7489dc8c#comment-1036822

Certainly you should install external lightning addons first, since the bundled lightning extension itself is not provided (as in 2.49.4 and before).
Yes, I had to install Lightning first, then Lightbird works for me too.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by buc.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'waiting'.
This update has obsoleted [seamonkey-2.49.5-1.el7](https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2019-954cf3770a), and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
Rebuild to properly handle external lightning extension.

Update to 2.49.5
